title: How US-Indian NISAR Satellite Will Offer Unique Window on Earth
summary: A Q&A with the lead U.S. scientist of the mission, which will track changes in everything from wetlands to ice sheets to infrastructure damaged by natural disasters. The upcoming U.S.-India NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar) mission will observe Earth like no mission before, offering insights about our planet’s ever-changing surface. summary: The next full Moon is the Wolf Moon; the Ice or Old Moon; the Moon after Yule; the start of Prayag Kumbh Mela; Shakambhari Purnima; Paush Purnima; the Thiruvathira, Thiruvathirai, or Arudhra Darisanam festival Moon; and Duruthu Poya. title: NASA Names Adam Schlesinger as Commercial Lunar Payload Services Project Manager
summary: NASA has selected Adam Schlesinger as manager for CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services). title: Defying Gravity
summary: In this Dec. 11, 1963, image, technicians prepare a test subject for studies on the Reduced Gravity Walking Simulator at NASA’s Langley Research Center in Hampton, Virginia. This position meant that a person’s legs experienced only one sixth of their weight, which was the equivalent of being on the Moon’s surface. The simulator was used […]

title: NASA Chooses Nuclear Fission Power for Humans on Mars
summary: NASA has made its first key architecture decision on the branching road to Mars: nuclear fission will power the first human missions on the Martian surface.

title: Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) and Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR)
summary: The SBIR/STTR programs provide an opportunity for small, high technology companies and research institutions (RI) to participate in Government sponsored research and development (R&D) efforts in key technology areas.
